steps.title: Wash the lime to clean it.
steps.content: Wash the lime to clean it. Since the peel will come into contact with the food or drink, it needs to be cleaned. Wipe dry with a kitchen towel. [1] X Trustworthy Source US Food and Drug Administration U.S. government agency responsible for promoting public health Go to source

steps.title: Place the lime on the wooden cutting board.
steps.content: Place the lime on the wooden cutting board.

steps.title: Cut a thin slice through the lime.
steps.content: Cut a thin slice through the lime. Cut as many thin slices as you'll need to use for garnish or decoration. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Place the slice flat on the cutting board.
steps.content: Place the slice flat on the cutting board . Using the knife, make a small cut halfway through the lime slice. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Pick up the cut lime slice.
steps.content: Pick up the cut lime slice. Twist the two sides of the cut (slit) in opposite directions. Then fold around. The lime slice is now a lime twist and is ready to use as a garnish.

steps.title: Repeat with the remaining lime slices.
steps.content: Repeat with the remaining lime slices.
